alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Bandera; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Comal; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Gillespie; Guadalupe; Hays; Karnes; Kendall; Kerr; Kinney; Llano; Maverick; Medina; Real; Travis; Uvalde; Val Verde; Williamson; Wilson; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 28 at 2:51PM CDT until March 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... Low relative humidities and gusty winds continue this afternoon. Minimum RH values in the low 20s to mid 30s are expected along and west of Highway 281 and in the mid 30 to low 40s farther east along the U.S. 77 corridor. South to southeast winds will increase to 15 to 20 mph with gusts between 20 and 30 mph this afternoon and early evening. Slightly more humidity is expected Tuesday, but there will be also a stronger south winds of around 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. Despite not strictly meeting criteria, this combination of dry air and moderate winds will lead to near critical to critical fire weather conditions and with ongoing fires in the area the decision was made to issue another Red Flag Warning from 10am-8pm today and again Tuesday for most of South Central Texas. Fuels remain unusually dry, and this is leading to an active season of wildfires that are difficult to contain. Any outdoor activity that could lead to the development of sparks and resulting wildfire potential is highly discouraged! ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS ALL OF SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY OVER ALL PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS WEST OF A TAYLOR TO SEGUIN TO KENEDY LINE... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM CDT Tuesday. * WINDS...Southeast 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimums 20 to 30 percent west of Highway 281...slightly higher east. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
